channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: The George Floyd protests have done the unthinkable
Trump floats another dangerous conspiracy theory
Fox News anchor apologizes after offensive image airs
item.description: Fox News anchor Bret Baier took a moment during his show to apologize for an image that aired comparing stock market performance after widely publicized cases of violence against black men.

item.title: Biden speaks via video at Floyd funeral: 'We can't turn away. We must not turn away'
WHO forced to clarify official's confusing remarks on asymptomatic spread of Covid-19
Ebola was 'scary', HIV was 'insidiously' spread, but Covid-19 is Fauci's 'worst nightmare'
Teen cycles 750 miles to take her father home amid lockdown
item.description: A 15 year-old Indian girl, who cycled 750 miles to take her injured father home, has brought attention to the plight of migrant workers caught in the lockdown. Activists say her story highlights desperate measures migrants are taking under the Covid-19 lockdown in India. CNN's Vedika Sud reports.

item.title: Daniel Radcliffe responds to J.K. Rowling's tweets about gender identity
item.description: The boy who lived is speaking out.

item.title: Dictionary to update definition of racism after woman's email
item.description: Kennedy Mitchum wasn't expecting much when she emailed Merriam-Webster last month, but she wanted to let the dictionary publisher know that she thought its definition of the word racism was inadequate.

item.title: A school called off Ivanka Trump's commencement speech. See what she blamed
item.description: Wichita State University Tech, an affiliate of Wichita State University in Kansas, canceled Ivanka Trump's virtual graduation speech amid backlash over President Donald Trump's response to George Floyd's death and the nationwide protests. CNN's Briana Keilar speaks to a graduate of the school about the decision.

item.title: The border spat between India and China is turning into an all-out media war
item.description: China and India's latest border dispute may have mainly involved scuffles and troop maneuvers on the ground, but it has been all-out war in the respective countries' media.

item.title: Russia raises stakes with 'brazen' military intervention in Libyan conflict
item.description: The voice behind the camera rings with falsetto glee as the frame fills with the remains of an aircraft, its wings burned and skeletal, its jet engine slumped in the wreckage.

item.title: 'Miss Hitler' pageant entrant and her partner jailed for belonging to neo-Nazi group
item.description: A former "Miss Hitler" pageant entrant and her partner have been jailed in the UK for belonging to the extreme right-wing neo-Nazi group National Action.

item.title: North Korea isn't talking to the South anymore. Experts say it could be trying to manufacture a crisis
item.description: North Korea has shut off all lines of communication with "enemy" South Korea -- a likely signal that Pyongyang is adopting a more confrontational stance towards Seoul after more than two years of detente and failed peace talks.

item.title: Dozens of Republicans urge Trump not to pull US troops from Germany
item.description: Nearly two-dozen Republicans on the House Armed Services Committee are pushing back on a White House plan to draw down US troops in Germany, according to a new letter sent to President Donald Trump on Tuesday.

item.title: Nasdaq tops 10,000 for the first time ever
item.description: Wall Street's love affair with technology stocks shows no sign of stopping.

item.title: Nigerian women protest against rape and sexual violence
item.description: Protesters have taken to the streets in cities across Nigeria to demand urgent action to combat rape and sexual violence against women.

item.title: This dangerous fuel spill is a warning of a future that we are unprepared for
item.description: An approximately 5-million-gallon diesel fuel spill from a power station storage tank near the Arctic town of Norilsk, Russia, poses a deadly threat to the region's people, plants, and animals. Even Russian President Vladimir Putin, who doesn't have a strong environmental track record, has declared a state of emergency.

item.title: Bill Barr contradicts President Trump on his move to bunker
item.description: Attorney General William Barr contradicted President Donald Trump when asked during a Fox News interview why the President was taken to the White House bunker during protests.

item.title: Britain's imperialist monuments face a bitter reckoning
Jerry Falwell Jr. apologizes for and deletes blackface tweet
item.description: Jerry Falwell Jr. is again under fire. This time, however, he is sorry.

item.title: 'The Flash' actor fired due to offensive tweets
item.description: Resurfaced old tweets allegedly posted by actor Hartley Sawyer prior to joining The CW series "The Flash" have resulted in him being fired.

item.title: Protests passed a wedding venue. A bride and groom joined them
item.description: A bride and groom in Philadelphia took a moment out of their wedding day to show solidarity with protesters that were marching against police brutality following the death of George Floyd. HLN's Melissa Knowles reports.

item.title: President of Burundi dies of cardiac arrest
item.description: Outgoing Burundi President Pierre Nkurunziza died after suffering a heart attack on Monday, according to a statement posted on the official Burundi government Twitter account.

item.title: Tesla may have some new competition from a company with a familiar name
item.description: Elon Musk and Tesla may have some new competition -- in the auto market, on Wall Street and on social media.

item.title: Probiotics don't do much for most people's gut health despite the hype, review finds
item.description: Whether contained in yogurt or stuffed into capsules and sold on pharmacy shelves, probiotics are popular among the health conscious, with millions of people around the world thought to use them.

item.title: Australia's rare, elusive night parrot may not see that well in the dark
item.description: Australia's night parrot is nocturnal, but the rare and elusive bird may not actually be able to see very well in the dark, according to a new study.

item.title: Sen. Mitt Romney participates in Floyd protest march
item.description: Republican Sen. Mitt Romney marched with evangelicals in Washington, telling a Washington Post reporter he was participating in the demonstration "to make sure that people understand that black lives matter." CNN's Pete Muntean has more.

item.title: The NFL should re-sign Colin Kaepernick, says Seahawks star
Series on indigenous activists wins top photography award
item.description: A powerful series depicting the plight of activists fighting to preserve their communities from mining and agribusiness has led to Uruguayan photographer Pablo Albarenga being named Photographer of the Year at the Sony World Photography Awards 2020.

item.title: See the effect that doing your laundry may be having
item.description: Fibers from synthetic clothing are one of the biggest sources of microplastic pollution. Their effect on the marine environment may be devastating.

item.title: Broadcaster takes down controversial Black Lives Matter anime
item.description: Japan's public broadcaster has taken down an anime video explaining the "Black Lives Matter" movement after receiving criticism that the video was offensive and failed to explain the complex racial issues accurately.

item.title: South Africans are suffering under lockdown but one industry is booming
item.description: In South Africa, a coronavirus ban on cigarettes and alcohol has sparked an illegal business. CNN's David McKenzie speaks with soldiers trying to enforce the ban and with a Zimbabwean cigarette smuggler, who says his "profits are up."

item.title: World's most expensive cities for expats in 2020 revealed
item.description: Spot the odd one out in this list of global cities: Hong Kong, Zurich, Singapore and... Ashgabat?

item.title: Are new restaurants crazy to be opening right now?
item.description: On Wednesdays, Palmetto, which opened for the first time on May 11 in Oakland, California, serves a full prime rib dinner -- to go.

item.title: Glass-bottom deck opens atop China's 'horizontal skyscraper'
item.description: It's easy to see why "The Crystal" is one of the most highly anticipated new attractions in China.

item.title: Party on, dude: 'Bill & Ted: Face the Music' trailer drops
item.description: Bill and Ted are back.

item.title: Tapper: What are Americans to make of these images?
item.description: CNN's Jake Tapper examines various incidents of police brutality caught on camera amid protests following the death of George Floyd.

item.title: Museum reimagines masterpieces in the pandemic, complete with face masks
item.description: A UK museum has released reimagined versions of some of its most loved masterpieces, with subjects donning face masks amid the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Banksy unveils art in support of Black Lives Matter
item.description: The anonymous artist shared new artwork and a statement on Instagram in light of recent civil rights protests worldwide.

item.title: Inside 'American Horror Story' creator's LA and NYC homes
item.description: Writer and director Ryan Murphy was 8 years old when his parents first let him decorate his room. "I decided to buck the bland and go bold: olive-green walls, chocolate-brown shag carpeting -- and a gold disco ball," he recalled in the latest issue of Architectural Digest, as he opened the doors to his quietly luxurious LA and New York homes.

item.title: Keanu Reeves on why he's returning for 'Matrix 4'
item.description: Keanu Reeves is already offering a sterling review of the planned new "Matrix."

item.title: Spectacular drone footage captures thousands of turtles nesting
item.description: Researchers have captured beautiful aerial footage of thousands of green turtles congregating on the edge of Australia's Great Barrier Reef during the nesting season.

item.title: NASCAR's Bubba Wallace wants to rid race tracks of the confederate flag
item.description: After wearing an "I Can't Breathe" T-shirt to Sunday's race, NASCAR driver Bubba Wallace said the next step is to rid the racetracks of the confederate flag.

item.title: Two weeks of nationwide protests has done the unthinkable: created a consensus among America's political leaders
item.description: • Pompeo's 'deafening' silence on racial injustice angers diplomats • LIVE: Biden, Sharpton speak at Floyd funeral • What happened when this city disbanded its police department 7 years ago

item.title: Biden and Sharpton deliver remarks at George Floyd's funeral
item.description: George Floyd was an "ordinary brother" from Houston's housing projects who "nobody thought much about," which makes his central role in a generational movement that much more powerful, the Rev. Al Sharpton said at his funeral Tuesday.

item.title: Pompeo's 'deafening' silence on racial injustice angers diplomats
item.description: As protests against racial injustice engulf America and spread globally, State Department officials have suggested Secretary of State Mike Pompeo address his workforce on the issue that, in many ways, directly impacts their work. So far, he has declined to do so, explained sources familiar with the suggestion.

item.title: WSJ: Trump nearly fired Esper in dispute over protest response
item.description: President Donald Trump came close to firing Secretary of Defense Mark Esper last week following their dispute over Trump's threat to use active-duty troops to quell large-scale protests across the United States, several officials told The Wall Street Journal.

item.title: What happened when a US city disbanded its police department
item.description: Last week, Minneapolis officials confirmed they were considering a fairly rare course of action: disbanding the city police department.

item.title: Police chief says to do this if you see police brutality
item.description: After an attorney representing one of the Minneapolis police officers charged in the death of George Floyd said the public should have intervened, Houston Police Chief Art Acevedo provides steps bystanders to police brutality can take.
